title: (x) Car magnet sign - Optima, Gill Sans {James}
content:
I've a client who handed us this today:   
 [http://www.studioangelus.com/images/mkfontsample.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516054754/http:/www.studioangelus.com/images/mkfontsample.gif)   
... for a car magnet sign, and it needs to be done tomorrow. I can find a "close enough" font or pull an all-nighter (well, a to-midnighter, which isn't good for my sleep habits) faking it in Freehand, but my sense of proffessional pride begs me to try to get it right before resorting to workarounds.   
   
A very close font I found on our communal work computer is "CG Omega" but for the life of me I couldn't find the font file to transfer to my own work machine.   
   
A coworker suggested Helvetica, but this has a touch of serif and (unless I'm mistaken) Helvetica is a sans.   
   
Sorry this got so long, and thanks for any help.
author: cieldailes

comments.content: Looks like [Optima](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516054754/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/optima/bold/testdrive.html?s=MIKOS&p=48) vertically stetched with Gill Sans at the bottom.

Yes, that's it exactly.   
...and oy, it's a pay font. My boss might not go for that, nice font or not. Guess I'll be faking it.   
   
Thanks anyhow.
If you have a Mac with OS X, I think Optima is already on it, as is Gill Sans.

We're on Windows machines, sad to say (at least for this).   
   
Edit: Well, poo. I don't have a lookalike font in my system. If anyone can point me towards a free lookalike I will be absolutely delighted (and remain employed).
Check your mail. I may have a solution that's not unethical.
On some Windows machines you might find a version of Optima called Zapf Humanist -- you might see if you have that, by any chance.
Just found Humanist two minutes ago, in fact, and snagged it. Proving to be better than the vectored shapes I was trying to concoct! Thanks.

Hey when I click on the link to your sample I get a prissy little message about bandwidth theft. I don't even know what that is (most people appreciate any traffic to their site), but it ain't in Optima that's for sure. Whassup with this??

Patricia-- sorry about that, my bandwitdh protection protocols must've kicked in with so much traffic. I had it set to let a clicked-on URL work properly, but obviously it needs tweaking.   
   
I did that because I've had problems with people hotlinking pictures from my site. That's when a site grabs pictures from other sites and eats up the others' bandwidth, which is usually limited to so much traffic a month. If it goes over a certain amount, I have to pay a higher fee. I do appreciate traffic to my site, but I'd rather they come to my page instead of seeing my artwork hotlinked without permission.   
   
The link originally led to a .gif that was a scan of what I was looking for. I apologise for the confusion and I'll edit the original post now that my problem's been solved.   
   
(And I am sorry about it being "prissy" but it's certainly not directed at you. It's meant to be prissy to those who hotlink without permission.)   
   
EDIT: Er, it seems I can't edit my original link. I again apologise to anyone who got my pagebreaking anti-hotlink message graphic. Perhaps an admin can edit the post for me and avoid any more faux-pas?

I'm sorry if my note sounded prissy too - but I have actually backed my way into some very interesting & well designed web sites through this forum. It's one of the reasons I come here. I have also gotten some nice comments on my own site from others here and don't much care how they got to it.

Just one last note before I turn in for the night, Patricia-- I just took a trip through your sites and I'm very impressed. Your graphic work is clever and fresh and I just love the jellyfish and woodwork paintings.
Thanks! I like the lettering and navigation on your site.
Thanks! It's all hand-drawn, did it several years ago.
